results.content:
First of all, this course is a continuation of the course "Create ASP.Net Core Web API (step by step for beginners)" so I highly suggest that beginners start with that course to completely understand what's going on.
If you already know how APIs work and don't mind that some things are not explained, like what DTOs are, then go ahead and give this course a shot.

Now, for my personal experience of this course, I must say that I really like the repetition of same code and functionality with just minor changes so the student sees the same things again and again. This way of teaching programming really fits with me.

I also like that the videos are short and in small parts with easy to navigate video titles. It makes it very easy to find the things that I want to re-watch, and it also makes it easier to digest when the material comes in small bits, and I find myself saying "just one more video" because they are short.
You can easily find courses that have lots of 20+ minute videos in them, and I just find it mentally hard to start a new video because I feel I have to dedicate more time to them. 

The time to learn, understand and code along or whatever easily exceeds the video length itself, so 20 minute videos with completely new stuff takes more to time to digest than you would think, so I really like the short video length style that this instructor uses.

If you are into learning by repetition with practical exercises then definitely consider this course.
The instructor was also very fast to reply to questions in the Q&A.

The course is taught using ASP.NET Core 2.2 but can easily be followed with ASP.NET Core 3.1, which I did, and needs only some very small tweaks to do so. 

If I had to put a finger on a thing that I would want to be improved, it would have to be that the more complicated stuff is introduced late in the course, and that means that there's less opportunity to practice them, which is a bit unfortunate.

But all in all, I'm very satisfied, and wish that the instructor would make courses that teaches more intermediate and advanced C# and ASP.NET topics, and also best practices in coding, with lots of opportunities to practice them in practical projects.

results.content: Another great course.  Easy to follow but lots of advanced ideas.  Watch you version of .net core.  I was able to do this in Version 3.1 but it took a bit of research to do it.
results.content_html: Another great course. Easy to follow but lots of advanced ideas. Watch you version of .net core. I was able to do this in Version 3.1 but it took a bit of research to do it.

results.content: It would have been helpful to say at the beginning: 'study the API course first'.
results.content_html: It would have been helpful to say at the beginning: 'study the API course first'.

results.content: Great course and tutor! It's a well structured course and all the concepts are explained well. It was also easy to follow through. Hope to see more C# and ASP.NET Core courses in the future from mister Almasi. :)

response.content: Thank you for your wonderful review! I'm really happy you found the course useful.
response.content_html: Thank you for your wonderful review! I'm really happy you found the course useful.

results.content: In the first two minutes of the first section I am encountering an error which is not explained. I can't set up a database migration using the information given in the tutorial.

response.content: The student never contacted me regarding the problem he encountered and never submitted a Q&A question. The student already refunded the course so I had no chance to help him resolve the problem. I had no other of the 1000+ students reporting any issue with Database Migration Set up.
